f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    196
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    197     This rule should usually be generated using
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    198     `//node/tools/npm:gen_build_npm`, like this:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    199
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    200       bazel run @org_dropbox_rules_node//node/tools/npm:gen_build_npm -- my-module@1.2.3 ~/src/myrepo/npm/my-module
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    201
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    202     Defines an external npm module. The module and its dependencies
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    203     are downloaded using `npm_installer`.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    204
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    205     All of the module's dependencies are declared in the shrinkwrap but
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    206     aren't known by Bazel. This is to work around Bazel's restrictions on
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    207     circular dependencies.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    208
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    209     One restriction that this rule places on it's output is that all
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    210     the files output must either be in the module's directory or in
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    211     '.bin'. E.g. if the module is named `module-name`, then this list
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    212     of contents is legal:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    213
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    214         contents = [
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    215             'module-name/src/something.js',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    216             '.bin/some-binary',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    217         ]
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    218
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    219     But this list of contents is not:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    220
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    221         contents = [
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    222             'module-name/src/something.js',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    223             'another-modules/something-else.js',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    224         ]
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    225
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    226     This allows us to be reasonably sure that any two modules can be
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    227     used together (except when '.bin' has conflicts, which should be
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    228     rare).
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    229

    230     Args:

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    461 """Creates a node binary, which is an executable Node program consisting
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    462 of a collection of `.js` source files.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    463
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    464 Node binaries are created using `--preserve-symlinks`.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    465
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    466 One quirk of this rule is that if your script uses the pattern:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    467
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    468 ```javascript
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    469   if (require.main === module) {
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    470 ```
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    471
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    472 to only execute something if the node script is the "main" script,
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    473 you'll need to modify it to check `BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID` against the
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    474 module id instead, like this:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    475
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    476 ```javascript
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    477   if (process.env['BAZEL_NODE_MAIN_ID'] === module.id || require.main === module) {
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    478 ```
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    479
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    480 All node modules that this rule depends on, direct and transitive, end
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    481 up flattened in `{package-directory}/node_modules`, where
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    482 `package-directory` is the directory that the node_binary target
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    483 is it. This means that, across all of your transitive dependencies
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    484 tracked by Bazel, you can't depend on different versions of the same
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    485 node module. (This does not apply to transitive dependencies of
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    486 npm_library rules, which are not tracked by Bazel.)
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    487
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    488 The environmental variable `NODE_PATH` is set to
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    489 `{package-directory}/node_modules` so that all the files that end up
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    490 running can find all the included node modules.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    491
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    492 One side-effect of that is that node libraries have access to all the
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    493 transitive dependencies for the node binary that depends on them.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    494
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    495 Examples:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    496     ```python
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    497     node_binary(
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    498         name = 'mybin',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    499         srcs = [
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    500             'mybin.js',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    501         ],
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    502         expose_gc = True,
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    503         main = 'mybin.js',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    504         deps = [
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    505             '//npm/loose-envify',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    506             '//npm/minimist',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    507             '//npm/mkdirp',
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    508         ],
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    509     )```
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    510
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    540   max_old_memory: Optional. Node, by default, doesn't run its garbage collector on old space
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    541     until a maximum old space size limit is reached. This overrides the default (of around 1.4gb)
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    542     with the provided value in MB.

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    544     garbage collection.

f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    580     Defines a node test that uses mocha. Takes the same args as

    817     It's recommend that you use the internal node module `dbx-bazel-utils`
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    818     (`@org_dropbox_rules_node//node/dbx-bazel-utils`). If you use it like
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    819     this:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    820
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    821     ```javascript
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    822     var dbxBazelUtils = require('dbx-bazel-utils');
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    823     var env = dbxBazelUtils.initBazelEnv(__dirname);
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    824     ```
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    825
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    826     Then it will set the working directory to the directory that contains
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    827     webpack.config.js, which is usually what you want, and you should
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    828     output to the directory in `env.outputRoot`.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    829
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    830     If the webpack build is run outside of Bazel, then `env.outputRoot`
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    831     will be `__dirname`.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    832
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    833     Defaults to using webpack@3.4.1. You can specify your own webpack
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    834     target with `webpack_target`.
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    835
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    836     Examples:
f70174b564c582757a940c8fd0aa02fcbfafbca7[Sun 27 Oct 2019 09:38:04 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
